text: VOTE OF CONDOLENCE : Hon. Dingiri Banda Wijetunga, Former President
PARLIAMENT 2008 08 2008 08, Wednesday, 08th October, 2008 . . 9.30 . [ . . . ] . . . 9.30 . [ . . . ] . The Parliament met at 9.30 a. m. MR. SPEAKER [ THE HON. W. J. M. LOKUBANDARA] in the Chair.
. Petition ordered to be referred to the Committee on Public Petitions.
ORAL ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS : : PADUKKA DIVISIONAL SECRETARYS DIVISION : FOREIGN LIQUAR SHOPS

asked the Minister of Finance and Planning : (a) Will he inform this House of (i) the number of foreign liquor shops; (ii) the number of holiday resorts where foreign liquor was available; and (iii) the number of tourist resorts where foreign liquor was available; which had been in the Padukka Divisional Secretarys Division before the Presidential Election held in November 2005? (b) Will he submit to this House (i) the number of foreign liquor shops; (ii) the number of holiday resorts where foreign liquor is available; and (iii) the number of tourist resorts where foreign liquor is available; which are in the Padukka Divisional Secretarys Division at present, after the Presidential Election held in November 2005? (c) Will he state (i) the number of foreign liquor shops, holiday resorts and tourist resorts that are situated in the aforesaid Divisional Secretarys Division and which have been issued with liquor licences after the aforesaid Presidential Election; and (ii) the names and addresses of the owners of them? (d) If not, why?

THIMBIRIGASYAYA DIVISIONAL SECRETARYS DIVISION : FOREIGN LIQUOR SHOPS 0144/08 5.

? () , ? asked the Minister of Finance and Planning, (a) Will he inform this House of (i) the number of foreign liquor shops; (ii) the number of holiday resorts where foreign liquor was available; and (iii) the number of tourist resorts where foreign liquor was available; which had been in the Thimbirigasyaya Divisional Secretarys Division before the Presidential Election held in November 2005? (b) Will he submit to this House (i) the number of foreign liquor shops; (ii) the number of holiday resorts where foreign liquor is available; and (iii) the number of tourist resorts where foreign liquor is available; which are in the Thimbirigasyaya Divisional Secretarys Division at present, after the Presidential Election held in November 2005? (c) Will he state (i) the number of foreign liquor shops, holiday resorts and tourist resorts that are situated in the aforesaid Divisional Secretariat Division and which have been issued with liquor licences after the aforesaid Presidential Election; and (ii) the names and addresses of the owners of them? (d) If not, why?

() , ? asked the Minister of Finance and Planning, (a) Will he inform this House of (i) the number of foreign liquor shops; (ii) the number of holiday resorts where foreign liquor was available; and (iii) the number of tourist resorts where foreign liquor was available; which had been in the Dehiwala-Mt. Lavinia Divisional Secretariat Division before the Presidential Election held in November 2005? (b) Will he submit to this House (i) the number of foreign liquor shops; (ii) the number of holiday resorts where foreign liquor is available; and (iii) the number of tourist resorts where foreign liquor is available; which are in the Dehiwala-Mt. (d) If not, why?

( ) (Mr. Speaker) , . : : MEEGAHAJANDURA AGRARIAN SERVICE CENTRE AREA : TENANT FARMERS AND PADDY LANDS 0461/08 12.
asked the Minister of Agricultural Development and Agrarian Services :
(i) the number of acres of paddy lands in the Meegahajandura Agrarian Service Centre area in the Hambantota District as at 31.12.2007; and

(ii) separately, the extent of land identified as falling into the categories of major irrigated, minor irrigated and rain fed, out of the number of acres of paddy lands mentioned in the answer for (a) (i) above?
(b) Will he submit to this House,
(i) the number of tenant farmers engaged in paddy farming in the relevant area as at 31.12.2007 and the number of acres of paddy lands cultivated by them;
(ii) the number of farmers who have their own paddy lands and the number of acres of paddy lands cultivated by them; and
(iii) if there are any other types of farmers other than the two types of farmers mentioned above, their number and the number of acres of paddy lands cultivated by them?

(i) the number of disputes that have arisen between the land owner and the successor owing to the death of the tenant farmer during the period up to 31.12.2007, since implementation of the Agrarian Development Act in the year 2000;
(ii) the number of disputes of tenant farmers that have been reported to the Assistant Commissioner of Agrarian Services from the relevant area; and
(iii) the number of successors who have been accorded the rights of tenant farmers?

( ) (The Hon. Anura Dissanayake) . . . ( ) (Mr. Speaker) . ( ) (The Hon. Vijitha Ranaweera) , ? ( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) , . : : BANDAGIRIYA AGRARIAN SERVICE CENTRE AREA : TENANT FARMERS AND PADDY LANDS 0462/08 13.
() , ? asked the Minister of Agricultural Development and Agrarian Services :

(a) Will he inform this House, (i) the number of acres of paddy lands in the Bandagiriya Agrarian Service Centre area in the Hambantota District as at 31.12.2007; and (ii) separately, the extent of land identified as falling into the categories of major irrigated, minor irrigated and rain fed, out of the number of acres of paddy lands mentioned in the answer for (a) (i) above?
(b) Will he submit to this House, (i) the number of tenant farmers engaged in paddy farming in the relevant area as at 31.12.2007 and the number of acres of paddy lands cultivated by them;
(ii) the number of farmers who have their own paddy lands and the number of acres of paddy lands cultivated by them; and

(iii) if there are any other types of farmers other than the two types of farmers mentioned above, their number and the number of acres of paddy lands cultivated by them? (c) Will he state, (i) the number of disputes that have arisen between the land owner and the successor owing to the death of the tenant farmer during the period up to 31.12.2007, since implementation of the Agrarian Development Act in the year 2000;
(ii) the number of disputes of tenant farmers that have been reported to the Assistant Commissioner of Agrarian Services from the relevant area; and
(iii) the number of successors who have been accorded the rights of tenant farmers? (d) If not, why?

: : AMBALANTOTA AGRARIAN SERVICE CENTRE AREA : TENANT FARMERS AND PADDY LANDS 0463/08 14.

() , ? asked the Minister of Agricultural Development and Agrarian Services : (a) Will he inform this House, (i) the number of acres of paddy lands in the Ambalantota Agrarian Service Centre area in the Hambantota District as at 31.12.2007; and (ii) separately, the extent of land identified as falling into the categories of major irrigated, minor irrigated and rain fed, out of the number of acres of paddy lands mentioned in the answer for (a) (i) above? (b) Will he submit to this House, (i) the number of tenant farmers engaged in paddy farming in the relevant area as at 31.12.2007 and the number of acres of paddy lands cultivated by them; (ii) the number of farmers who have their own paddy lands and the number of acres of paddy lands cultivated by them; and
(iii) if there are any other types of farmers other than the two types of farmers mentioned above, their number and the number of acres of paddy lands cultivated by them?

(c) Will he state, (i) the number of disputes that have arisen between the land owner and the successor owing to the death of the tenant farmer during the period up to 31.12.2007, since implementation of the Agrarian Development Act in the year 2000; (ii) the number of disputes of tenant farmers that have been reported to the Assistant Commissioner of Agrarian Services from the relevant area; and
(iii) the number of successors who have been accorded the rights of tenant farmers? (d) If not, why?
( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) . . ( ) (The Hon. Vijitha Ranaweera) . . : : PRINCIPAL OF KOOMBIYANGODA SUJATHA GIRLS SCHOOL : COMPLAINTS 0503/08 15.

? () , ? asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administration, and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order,: (a) Will he inform this House (i) the number of complaints which have been received by the Matale Police Station regarding the Principal of the Matale Koombiyangoda Sujatha Girls School from the year 2006 up to now; and (ii) the matters on which the aforesaid complaints have been received? (b) Will he inform this House separately (i) the date of lodging the entry, the number, and the names of the complainants of each of the aforesaid complaints; (ii) the dates on which the aforesaid complaints were looked into; and (iii) the ruling given with regard to those complaints? (c) Will he state whether the both relevant parties were summoned to the police station on the dates on which the aforesaid complaints were looked into? (d) If not, why?

( . . - ) (The Hon. M. H. Cegu Isadean - Minister of Export Development ) Sir, on behalf of the Minister of Export Development and International Trade, I ask for three months time. ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Hon. Minister why do you require three months time to give the details of the expenditure that has been incurred over the last 15 months ? . . ( . . ) (The Hon. M. H. Cegu Isadean ) Because the Question is very lengthy and it will require a long time to give the Answer. So, I request, Hon. Speaker, for three months time.

( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Unless you want to conceal information from this House, Hon Minister, there is no reason why such an innocuous Question cannot be answered. Is it because the Hon. Minister has gone out of the country more than 48 times that you do not want to highlight it to this House ? . . ( . . ) (The Hon. M. H. Cegu Isadean ) Mr. Speaker, give us at least two months time. ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake)

I am asking you a logical question. You are a person who is intelligent and who is able to stand on your own feet. Is it because your Minister has gone out of the country more than four times a month that you do not want to answer that Question in this House ?

. . ( . . ) (The Hon. M. H. Cegu Isadean ) During the first round you were not here I could have easily tabled this, but I have been waiting to tell you that I need three months time to answer this Question. ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake)
Why do you want three months time? Why can you not answer it tomorrow ? You have expended time. I am not asking what you intend doing in the future ?

: , : MINISTER OF POSTS AND TELECOMMUNICATION : OVERSEAS TRIPS
() , ? asked the Minister of Posts and Telecommunication : (a) Will he inform this House
(i) of the number of overseas trips that the Minister of Posts and Telecommunication had undertaken for the last three years; (ii) the countries visited; and

(iii) the total cost of each trip along with the tickets and hotel charges separately? (b) Will he state (i) the number of persons accompanied; (ii) their names and the cost incurred on them separately; and
(iii) the main reason for each overseas trip?
(c) Will he also state (i) the budgeted allowance; and (ii) the supplementary expenditure provided for such trips? (d) If not, why?

: : SEED SOYA BEAN PRODUCTION : GOVERNMENT FARMS 0181/08 7. ( . . . )
( - . . . - ) (The Hon. Nihal Galappaththi - on behalf of The Hon. R. P. A. Ranaweera Pathirana) , (1): () (i) ; (ii) 1987 2007 ; ? () (i) ; (ii) 1987 2007 ; ? () ? () ? () , ? , :

() ? () , ? asked the Minister of Agricultural Development and Agrarian Services,: (a) Will he submit to this House (i) out of the quantity of soya bean required for this country, the quantity which is produced locally; and (ii) the quantity of soya bean that has been produced in each year from 1987 to 2007? (b) Will he inform this House

(i) the number of Government farms that produce seeds required for the production of soya bean and the names of such farms; and (ii) the quantity of seed soya bean produced annually by each of the above mentioned farms during the period from 1987 to 2007? (c) Will he admit the fact that the farmers who cultivate soya bean have faced difficulties due to the non-availability of quality seed soya bean? (d) If the Soya Bean cultivation has collapsed, will he submit to this House, the methodology that will be adopted to enhance the soya bean cultivation? (e) If not, why?
( - . . . - ) (The Hon. Nihal Galappaththi - on behalf of The Hon. R. P. A. Ranaweera Pathirana) - (1)

asked the Minister of Agricultural Development and Agrarian Services, (a) Will he submit to this House (i) out of the quantity of potatoes required for this country, the quantity which is produced locally; and (ii) the quantity of potatoes that has been produced in each year from 1987 to 2007? (b) Will he inform this House, (i) the number of Government farms that produce seed potatoes required for the production of potatoes and the names of such farms; and (ii) the quantity of seed potatoes produced annually by each of the above - mentioned farms during the period from 1987 to 2007? (c) Will he admit the fact that the farmers who cultivate potatoes have faced difficulties due to the non-availability of quality seed potatoes? (d) If the Potato cultivation has collapsed, will he submit to this House, the methodology that will be adopted to enhance the potato cultivation? (e) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) , * . * * : *Answer tabled () (i) . . 132,000 . 2007 . . 77,930. ( 59% .) (ii) 1987 2007 : 1987 81,042 1988 87,535 1989 83,471
: : THHLHIRIYA TEXTILE MILL : ALLOWANCES AND COMPENSATION

asked the Minister of Industrial Development, (a) Will he inform this House of the number of employees who have been removed from the service of Thulhiriya Textile Mill of the Textile Corporation which was taken over by the Government, from 01.06.1990, the date on which its employees were attached to Kabul Lanka Company, up to the sale of that institution to Mass Holding Company, and subsequent to the sale up to now? (b) Will he admit that (i) Thulhiriya Textile Mill was sold to Kabul Lanka Company on 01.06.1990 and subsequently, to Mass Holding Company on 31.07.2006, on the basis of providing employment again after paying compensation to all the employees with the intervention of the Government so that their employment and rights would be preserved; and (ii) nevertheless, no compensation has been paid to the persons who have been re-recruited or the persons who have left the service up to now? (c) Will he take steps to pay all the allowances and compensations due to the aforesaid employees on their employment rights and for the inconveniences they had to undergo, to all those who were employed at Kabul Lanka Company from the time it was privatized and are retired now, all the employees who were working until the institution was closed down on 11.09.2003 and all those who were employed until it was sold to Mass Holding Company on 31.07.2006?

OYAMADUWA AND PARASANGANWEWA FARMS : LEASE-OUT 0310/08 10. ( ) ( - - ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake - on behalf of The Hon. Ranjith Aluvihare) , - (1): () 50 ? () (i) ; (ii) ; (iii) ; ? () ? () ? : () 50 ? () (i) , (ii) , (iii) ? () ? () , ?

asked the Minister of Livestock Development: (a) Is he aware that arrangements have been made to lease out the Oyamaduwa and Parasanganwewa farms in the Anuradhapura District belong to the National Livestock Development Board, to an Indian Company for 50 years? (b) Will he inform this House (i) separately, the extent of Parasanganwewa and Oyamaduwa farms in acres; (ii) the number of employees who work in the aforesaid farms; and (iii) the progress achieved up to now? (c) Will he submit to this House, the reasons as to why the aforesaid two farms were leased out to an Indian company? (d) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) , * .
: UNIVERSITY OF RAJARATA : SECURITY SERVICE 0317/08 11. ( - - ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake - on behalf of The Hon. Rahjith Aluvihare ) , (1): () (i) ; (ii) ; (iii) 2004 ;

asked the Minister of Higher Education,(1) (a) Will he inform this House (i) the name of the private security service which has been employed to provide security services to the University of Rajarata at Mihintale; (ii) the name of owner of the aforesaid security service; (iii) whether tenders have been called from private security firms to provide security service to the University of Rajarata in the Year 2004; and (iv) if tenders have been called as mentioned above, the names of the insititutions that submitted tenders and the quotations submitted by them?

(b) Will he state (i) whether the North Central Security service (Pvt) Company has provided security services to the aforesaid university; (ii) if the aforesaid company has provided security services, the period of time in which it was done; and (iii) the reason for not obtaining the security services of that company again? (c) If not, why

: VOTE OF CONDOLENCE : HON. DINGIRI BANDA WIJETUNGA, FORMER PRESIDENT [.. 10.31] ( ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva - Minister of Healthcare and Nutrition and Leader of the House of Parliament) , , .

. . , . , . . . - - , , .. . , , . ! . ( ) (The Deputy Speaker) . . . [.. 11.28] . ( . ) (The Hon. R. Sampanthan) Mr. Deputy Speaker, it was my good fortune to come to know the late Mr. D.B. Wijetunga, who was both Prime Minister and President of Sri Lanka, quite well in the post-1977 period when he was the Minister of Posts and Telecommunication in the J.R. Jayewardene Government. He was a very genial person, a very mild person and a very pleasant person to interact with at all times. I must quite frankly state that I was not in agreement with many of the political views he expressed, particularly on the national question, at the time when he was the President of this country, and that none of the minorities in this country would have accepted the views expressed by Mr. D.B. Wijetunga when he was the President of this country. Nevertheless, I think we all accepted that he was a person who was committed to certain values; he was a man of integrity and he was not a person who put forward pretences. He spoke quite frankly about whatever he wanted to say and insofar as the democratic process was concerned, I think he endeavoured to preserve the values of the democratic process and to promote it. He realized the importance of preserving and promoting democratic values and I think that was a very significant trait in his character which showed eventually that he was a true democrat. It must also be mentioned, Mr. Deputy Speaker, that Mr. Wijetunga never sought high political office. In fact, when he became the Prime Minister of this country when

Mr. Premadasa was the President, that was a bit of a surprise to the people of this country because there were many other aspirants for the Prime Ministerial position who were occupying the front row of the Government Benches. But, Mr. Premadasa for whatever reason, decided that he will make Mr. D.B. Wijetunga his Prime Minister and Mr. D.B. Wijetunga became the Prime Minister of this country. Similarly, I do not think he ever thought to become the President. When President Premadasa was killed, it so happened that Mr. Wijetunga who was the Prime Minister was elected as the President of the country by Parliament. So really, Sir, he was a person who never aspired to decide positions. But I think it was his destiny that without any such aspiration on his part he had to be both the Prime Minister and the President of this country. I thought it is my duty, Sir, in view of my very close association with him in the post-1977 period, and in view of the fact that he had always treated me with a great deal of courtesy and had always been very gentle and genial in his dealings with me to express these views in Parliament. I would join the Hon. Members in requesting that a copy of these proceedings be sent to the members of the bereaved family, to all of whom we convey our very sincere condolences. Thank you, Sir. ( ) (The Deputy Speaker) . . .
( . . - ) (The Hon. D. M. Jayaratne - Minister of Plantation Industries) , . . , . , . .. -- . . - - . , , . . . . - . .. . , , .

.. . . ( ) (The Deputy Speaker) . . ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Sir, I rise to a point of Order. This is regarding the provision of a helicopter to airlift the remains of late Major General Janaka Perera to Anuradhapura. As of this moment, we are made to understand that the helicopter has still not been given. Is this the respect that is being paid to a decorated officer who saved this country? The family is languishing there at the Ratmalana Airport. The Prime Minister yesterday, at 7.30 p.m., confirmed to Hon. Tissa Attanayake and us that it would be given. So, since only the Hon. D.M. Jayaratne, a senior Minister, is in the House at the moment, we call upon him to look into this. An inhuman act has been done to this gentleman.

[.. 3.32] .. ( ) ( . . - ) (The Hon. M.N. Abdul Majeed - Minister of Co-operatives) , . , , , .

Venerable Presiding Member, this House condoles today the death of a great leader of Sri Lanka, a former President, none other than the late Hon. D. B. Wijetunga. The late Hon. D. B. Wijetunga lived a full life. If am not mistaken, he lived up to the age of 92 years. He was a man who emerged from a very simple family. Because of his devotion, honesty and capability, he was able to enter Parliament long years ago. He entered Parliament, became a Minister, then the Prime Minister and finally the President. In between he had the fortune of being a Governor as well. During his tenure of office he discharged his duties for the welfare and benefit of the people of this country. I have a special reason to admire him. He was the President who promoted me to the Cabinet. When I was the Minister of Provincial Councils and Minister of State for Foreign Affairs, he took over the reins as the President of this country and immediately invited me to

his Cabinet and I was appointed as the Minister of Home Affairs and Provincial Councils. It was during that period under his leadership that the UNP Government was able to clear the East. I very distinctly remember that a large amount of funds were allocated through my Ministry at that time to reconstruct and rehabilitate the Assistant Government Agents offices in the Eastern Province which were all destroyed by the LTTE. There was nothing left; there was no administration. Having cleared the East, new divisional secretariats were set up whole throughout the East and I had the fortune of personally visiting the East to declare open those offices and restoring once again the administration in those areas. That was a great achievement when you consider the problems we had before. The East had been completely neglected. There was no development. With the opening of the new divisional secretariats, once again life in the Eastern Province got revived. Some are of the view that he was one of the luckiest politicians in this country. Most unexpectedly, when there were very many contenders for the position of Prime Minister during the Premadasa regime, without any problem he became the Prime Minister. He kept silent. He never went behind those positions. However, his loyalty was recognized by the late President Ranasinghe Premadasa and he was appointed as the Prime Minister. He was a man who was never taken up by positions. He discharged his duties well and most unexpectedly with the demise of President Premadasa, he became the President. There was no necessity for him to stand for elections for any of these posts. They were brought on to his lap. Therefore, everyone remembers the way he came up in the political ladder and the manner in which he conducted himself after having restored in these high positions, both as the Prime Minister and the President. He was not greedy for power. He did not want to hang on to the Presidency. As soon as he found that the country was in a different political direction, he called for an election and gave way for it. Therefore, people remember him as one of the finest politicians that Sri Lanka has ever produced; a man who rose from humble beginnings to the highest position in life. He had the greatest regard for Buddhism in this country. He gave the first place, the pride of place for Buddhism and ensured that peaceful harmony prevails among the communities who live in Sri Lanka. I, therefore condole the demise of the late President Wijetunga and we are sorry that we have lost a gentleman, a politician, a party politician of the United National Party who has contributed a great deal for the welfare of the country as well as for the United National Party. Thank you.
